verses.name: Micah 6:1
verses.text: Hear ye now what the Lord saith; Arise, contend thou before the mountains, and let the hills hear thy voice.

verses.name: Micah 6:2
verses.text: Hear ye, O mountains, the Lord’s controversy, and ye strong foundations of the earth: for the Lord hath a controversy with his people, and he will plead with Israel.

verses.name: Micah 6:3
verses.text: O my people, what have I done unto thee? and wherein have I wearied thee? testify against me.

verses.name: Micah 6:4
verses.text: For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed thee out of the house of servants; and I sent before thee Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

verses.name: Micah 6:5
verses.text: O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab consulted, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him from Shittim unto Gilgal; that ye may know the righteousness of the Lord.

verses.name: Micah 6:6
verses.text: Wherewith shall I come before the Lord, and bow myself before the high God? shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves of a year old?

verses.name: Micah 6:7
verses.text: Will the Lord be pleased with thousands of rams, or with ten thousands of rivers of oil? shall I give my firstborn for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?

verses.name: Micah 6:8
verses.text: He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the Lord require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God?

verses.name: Micah 6:9
verses.text: The Lord’s voice crieth unto the city, and the man of wisdom shall see thy name: hear ye the rod, and who hath appointed it.

verses.name: Micah 6:10
verses.text: Are there yet the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and the scant measure that is abominable?

verses.name: Micah 6:11
verses.text: Shall I count them pure with the wicked balances, and with the bag of deceitful weights?

verses.name: Micah 6:12
verses.text: For the rich men thereof are full of violence, and the inhabitants thereof have spoken lies, and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.

verses.name: Micah 6:13
verses.text: Therefore also will I make thee sick in smiting thee, in making thee desolate because of thy sins.

verses.name: Micah 6:14
verses.text: Thou shalt eat, but not be satisfied; and thy casting down shall be in the midst of thee; and thou shalt take hold, but shalt not deliver; and that which thou deliverest will I give up to the sword.

verses.name: Micah 6:15
verses.text: Thou shalt sow, but thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the olives, but thou shalt not anoint thee with oil; and sweet wine, but shalt not drink wine.

verses.name: Micah 6:16
verses.text: For the statutes of Omri are kept, and all the works of the house of Ahab, and ye walk in their counsels; that I should make thee a desolation, and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore ye shall bear the reproach of my people.
